form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Durbin (for himself, Ms. Duckworth, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Padilla, and Mr. Schatz) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To prioritize funding for an expanded and sustained national investment in basic science research.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Innovation Act.

subsection.text: There are hereby authorized to be appropriated, and appropriated, out of any monies in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, the following:

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2036 and each fiscal year thereafter, the amount appropriated under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year, increased by the percentage increase (if any), during the previous fiscal year, in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

paragraph.header: Department of energy, office of science
paragraph.text: For the Office of Science at the Department of Energy—

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2036 and each fiscal year thereafter, the amount appropriated under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year, increased by the percentage increase (if any), during the previous fiscal year, in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

paragraph.header: Department of defense science and technology programs
paragraph.text: For the Department of Defense science and technology programs—

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2036 and each fiscal year thereafter, the amount appropriated under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year, increased by the percentage increase (if any), during the previous fiscal year, in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

paragraph.header: National institute of standards and technology scientific and technical research and services
paragraph.text: For the scientific and technical research and services of the National Institute of Standards and Technology at the Department of Commerce—

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2036 and each fiscal year thereafter, the amount appropriated under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year, increased by the percentage increase (if any), during the previous fiscal year, in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

paragraph.header: National aeronautics and space administration science mission directorate
paragraph.text: For the Science Mission Directorate at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration—

subparagraph.text: for fiscal year 2036 and each fiscal year thereafter, the amount appropriated under this paragraph for the previous fiscal year, increased by the percentage increase (if any), during the previous fiscal year, in the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

subsection.text: Amounts appropriated under subsection (a) shall remain available until expended.

paragraph.header: Department of defense science and technology programs
paragraph.text: The term Department of Defense science and technology programs means the appropriations accounts that support the various institutes, offices, and centers that make up the Department of Defense science and technology programs.
The term National Science Foundation means the appropriations accounts that support the various institutes, offices, and centers that make up the National Science Foundation.

paragraph.header: Office of science at the department of energy
paragraph.text: The term Office of Science at the Department of Energy means the appropriations accounts that support the various institutes, offices, and centers that make up the Department of Energy Office of Science.

paragraph.header: Science mission directorate at the national aeronautics and space administration
paragraph.text: The term Science Mission Directorate at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration means the appropriations accounts that support the various institutes, offices, and centers that make up the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Science Mission Directorate.

paragraph.header: Scientific and technical research and services of the national institute of standards and technology
paragraph.text: The term scientific and technical research and services of the National Institute of Standards and Technology means the appropriations accounts that support the various institutes, offices, and centers that make up the National Institute of Standards and Technology scientific and technical research and services.

subsection.header: Exemption of certain appropriations from sequestration

paragraph.text: Section 255(g)(1)(A) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act (2 U.S.C. 905(g)(1)(A)) is amended by inserting after Advances to the Unemployment Trust Fund and Other Funds (16–0327–0–1–600). the following:

subparagraph.text: Appropriations under the American Innovation Act.

paragraph.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to any sequestration order issued under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 900 et seq.) on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
The budgetary effects of this section shall not be entered on either PAYGO scorecard maintained pursuant to section 4(d) of the Statutory Pay As-You-Go Act of 2010 (2 U.S.C. 933(d)).
The budgetary effects of this section shall not be entered on any PAYGO scorecard maintained for purposes of section 4106 of H. Con. Res. 71 (115th Congress).
